website_summaries.verdict: This durable, ornately-colored kendama is sure to be a one-of-a-kind on the playground. Keep in mind, though, that the paint will chip over time, since the game requires the ball to be tossed against the cups and spike.
pros: Crafted with 3 cups and catching spike
Vivid, attractive colors with few chips
7-inch design good for elementary age children
cons: As with all painted kendamas, some scratches and chips will appear as the ball is banged against the cup

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but shows damage
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are a real pro with one the enamel will dent and chip off on the first use. That's really the only downside though and the price is nice enough that's I dont personally care. The weight of it and usability is nice though the ball feels oddly heavy compared to some I've tried it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Rozenkruetz

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for 6 year old. Think it is better for older child with better coordination & longer attention span. Adults did play with it, while trying to show the child how to play. Well made & larger than it appears in pictures. Liked that it was not a computer game.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K.

customer_reviews.title: Cool gift
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I’m a 25 year old sister and daughter and most of the time have NO idea what to get my 54 year old dad and 23 year old brother. BUT this... this was it! They loved it, loved playing games, loved setting records with each other and sending their progress with me, fun to play with friends and fun to do in your spare time. Cool and random gift that was both unexpected and really fun at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son has wanted one of these for a while so I finally decided to order one. I looked at multiple reviews on multiple different brands & this is the one we settled on. I like the red & black design a lot & it's very study. I will update if it breaks anytime soon but then again, it is for my toddler!
customer_reviews.author: BoyMama

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Kids love them, but the paint does chip but not bad. This was expected with kids though. One we got was perfect. The other was loose and a bit wobbly but we were able to fix it. Overall they are great for the price and perfect for beginners. We didn't want to spend alot if it was something they weren't going to stay interested in. We have a 6 and 9 year old and they are really getting into them!
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: and since he is a good kid, I got it for him
customer_reviews.text: My kid asked for this, and since he is a good kid, I got it for him. Seems to be just a sleek looking variation of the old ball on a string connected to a cup that our grandparents used to play with back before they invented real toys, but my kid is completely satisfied with it. And with him busy mastering this thing, I get to play his Xbox, so win for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: E. ONeill

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids and adults all ages
customer_reviews.text: Got a couple of these for my kids and they love them. It is a good game of skill and coordination that takes them away from other digital gadgets. Comes with an extra string in case one breaks. It is light and seems durable. My girls have fun playing with it and trying to best each other.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and well made

product_meta.title: Kendama Kraze Wood Toy - Extra String- Tribute Samurai Red & Black Pro Model
product_meta.description: Did You Know the Kendama is a traditional Japanese Wooden Toy? The word 'Ken' means 'Sword' and 'tama' means 'Ball', translating to the 'Sword and the Ball'. This challenging novelty toy is the perfect gift and is all the 'Kraze' for youngsters worldwide. Competitions are popping up across the globe for this worldwide phenomenon. The kendama is comprised of 3 cups, one on the bottom of the stick, and one one each side. The 2 cups on the side are actually different sizes, making one of the cups more difficult to catch the ball with. Of course, the most difficult trick of all is to catch the ball on the spike. While it may seem like a simple children's toy, the Kendama can entertain for hours as you try to master all of its difficult trick sequences.
feature_bullets: 2015 UNIQUE EXCLUSIVE DESIGN IS THE PERFECT SUMMER GIFT- The Original Ninja Brush Kendama's Exclusive Paint Design Makes Your Kendama Unique
EXTRA STRING INCLUDED- Each Kendama Kraze is Packaged with Extra String for Longer Play Value and More Fun with Your Friends
BECOME A PRO-Durable, Quality Wood Allows You to Play for Hours on End. Can You Master the Kendama?
SHOW OFF YOUR SKILLS by Catching the Ball in All 3 Cups and the Challenging Spike. This Games takes Yo-Yo's, Juggling, and Diabolo's to the Next Level.
LEARN NEW TRICKS WITH FRIENDS - Cool Twist on the Traditional Cup-and-Ball Game. Test Your Determination with This Traditional Japanese Wooden Toy and Add to Cart Today.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars367 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
